meanings.definition: The act of making something solemn or formal.
meanings.sent1: The solemnization of the document gave it an official status.
meanings.sent2: The solemnization of the contract was necessary for it to be legally binding.
meanings.sent3: The solemnization of the birthday party made it feel like a royal affair.
meanings.sent4: The solemnization of the decision brought a sense of gravity to the situation.
meanings.sent5: The solemnization of the oath made it feel sacred and important.

meanings.definition: The act of celebrating or performing a ceremony in a serious or dignified manner.
meanings.sent1: The solemnization of their wedding was a beautiful and emotional event.
meanings.sent2: The solemnization of the award ceremony was attended by many distinguished guests.
meanings.sent3: The solemnization of the school play turned it into a grand production.
meanings.sent4: The solemnization of the tradition was a solemn and respectful affair.
meanings.sent5: The solemnization of the ritual added a sense of reverence to the occasion.
